Method Detail

auth

AuthResult auth(TCredential credential)
                throws AuthenticationException.AccountBlocked,
                       AuthenticationException.AccountSuspended,
                       AuthenticationException.PasswordExpired,
                       AuthenticationException.BadCredentials,
                       AuthenticationException.NoSuchAccount,
                       AuthenticationException.PendingAccount,
                       AuthenticationException.ServiceNotAvailable,
                       AuthorizationException.NotPermitted,
                       PersistException,
                       ServiceException,
                       GatewayException
Method to authenticate a credential.

Parameters:
credential - - An object that includes enough information to authenticate a user is who they claim to be.
Returns:
An authtoken that can be used to make subsequent authenticated api calls and loginInfo indicating some useful information about the authenticated user.
Throws:
AuthenticationException.AccountBlocked - if the user has successively provided bad credentials too many times within a specified time period.
AuthenticationException.AccountSuspended - if the authOwner the credential indicates is suspended.
AuthenticationException.PasswordExpired - if the password for a temp password credential/auth combo is expired.
AuthenticationException.BadCredentials - if the information provided does not identify at least one auth.
AuthenticationException.NoSuchAccount - if the information provided does not eventually point to a proper authOwner.
AuthenticationException.PendingAccount
AuthenticationException.ServiceNotAvailable
AuthorizationException.NotPermitted
PersistException
ServiceException
GatewayException

superuserRequestPhoneAuth

                                     java.lang.String phone)

                                            AuthorizationException.NotPermitted,
                                            AuthenticationException.PendingAccount,
                                            OperationException.NotFound,
                                            PersistException,
                                            ServiceException,
                                            GatewayException
A superuser (admin tool user) may call this method to request a login token for a particular user account.

Parameters:
superuserAuthToken - a current auth token for the superuser
phone - the account number phone of the account to log into
Returns:
an auth result.
Throws:
AuthorizationException.InvalidToken - -
AuthorizationException.NotPermitted - -
AuthenticationException.PendingAccount - -
OperationException.NotFound - if an account with that phone number could not be found
PersistException - -
ServiceException - -
GatewayException

changePassword

void changePassword(TAuthToken authToken,
                    java.lang.String oldPassword,
                    java.lang.String newPassword)
                    throws AuthenticationException.BadCredentials,
                           AuthenticationException.AccountBlocked,
                           AuthenticationException.CannotChangeOwnPassword,
                           AuthenticationException.NoSuchAccount,
                           AuthenticationException.RejectedPassword.InsecurePassword,
                           AuthenticationException.RejectedPassword.IllegalCharactersInPassword,
                           AuthenticationException.RejectedPassword.MissingRequiredCharacterType,
                           AuthenticationException.RejectedPassword.TooShort,
                           AuthenticationException.RejectedPassword.TooLong,
                           AuthorizationException.InvalidToken,
                           AuthorizationException.NotPermitted,
                           AuthorizationException.AccountSuspended,
                           PersistException,
                           GatewayException,
                           ServiceException
change password for logins

Parameters:
authToken - token representing a current auth session
oldPassword - password to change
newPassword - password to change to
Throws:
AuthenticationException.BadCredentials - if the specified oldPassword is incorrect
AuthenticationException.AccountBlocked - if the account has been blocked
AuthenticationException.CannotChangeOwnPassword - if the user is not allowed to change his or her own password
AuthenticationException.NoSuchAccount - if no account can be found for the phone number
AuthenticationException.RejectedPassword.InsecurePassword - if the new password is insufficiently secure
AuthenticationException.RejectedPassword.IllegalCharactersInPassword - if the password contains characters that are illegal for this deployment
AuthenticationException.RejectedPassword.MissingRequiredCharacterType - if the password is missing a character of a required type. eg "must contain at least one number"
AuthenticationException.RejectedPassword.TooShort - if the new password is too short
AuthenticationException.RejectedPassword.TooLong - if the new password is too long
AuthorizationException.InvalidToken - if the auth token is invalid or has expired
AuthorizationException.NotPermitted - if the operation is not permitted for that token
AuthorizationException.AccountSuspended - if this account has been suspended
PersistException - in the case of a database or other persistence error
GatewayException - in the case of an error accessing a a service via a gateway
ServiceException - in the case of another error in the core service
AccountBlocked

resetPassword

void resetPassword(TAuthToken tToken,
                   TDescriptor descriptor,
                   java.lang.String newPassword)
                   throws AuthenticationException.CannotChangeOwnPassword,
                          AuthenticationException.RejectedPassword.InsecurePassword,
                          AuthenticationException.RejectedPassword.IllegalCharactersInPassword,
                          AuthenticationException.RejectedPassword.MissingRequiredCharacterType,
                          AuthenticationException.RejectedPassword.TooShort,
                          AuthenticationException.RejectedPassword.TooLong,
                          AuthorizationException.InvalidToken,
                          AuthorizationException.AccountSuspended,
                          AuthorizationException.NotPermitted,
                          PersistException,
                          GatewayException,
                          ServiceException
Method to change the password a user. The provided descriptor must match the information pointed to by the authToken.

Parameters:
tToken - - An authtoken.
descriptor - - Identifying information provided by the user.
newPassword - - The new password which the user would like to use.
Throws:
AuthenticationException.CannotChangeOwnPassword - if the user cannot edit their own account.
AuthenticationException.RejectedPassword.InsecurePassword
AuthenticationException.RejectedPassword.IllegalCharactersInPassword
AuthenticationException.RejectedPassword.MissingRequiredCharacterType
AuthenticationException.RejectedPassword.TooShort
AuthenticationException.RejectedPassword.TooLong
AuthorizationException.InvalidToken - if the provided token does not point to a user.
AuthorizationException.AccountSuspended - if the account is suspended.
AuthorizationException.NotPermitted
PersistException - if we have trouble communicating with the db.
GatewayException - if we have trouble with a remote server.
ServiceException - if we have trouble with a core service.

the description

                             AuthenticationException.RejectedPassword.TooShort,
                             AuthenticationException.RejectedPassword.TooLong,
                             AuthenticationException.RejectedPassword.MissingRequiredCharacterType,
                             ServiceException
Method to pre-validate a potential password before submission.

Parameters:
potentialPassword - the password to validate
Throws:
AuthenticationException.RejectedPassword.InsecurePassword - if the new password is insufficiently secure
AuthenticationException.RejectedPassword.IllegalCharactersInPassword - if the password contains characters that are illegal for this deployment
AuthenticationException.RejectedPassword.MissingRequiredCharacterType - if the password is missing a character of a required type. e.g. "must contain at least one number"
AuthenticationException.RejectedPassword.TooLong - if the new password is too long
AuthenticationException.RejectedPassword.TooShort - if the new password is too short
ServiceException - in the case of another error in the core service

getUpdatedLoginInfo

TLoginInfo getUpdatedLoginInfo(TAuthToken authToken)
                               throws AuthorizationException.AccountSuspended,
                                      AuthorizationException.InvalidToken,
                                      AuthorizationException.NotPermitted,
                                      PersistException,
                                      GatewayException,
                                      ServiceException
Method to fetch an updated copy of login info for the current login. Called when we do something that we suspect may have changed this information, like change timezone or change subscription level.

Parameters:
authToken - -
Returns:
newly created login info
Throws:
AuthorizationException.AccountSuspended - if the account is suspended.
AuthorizationException.InvalidToken - if the supplied auth token is invalid
AuthorizationException.NotPermitted - if the data cannot be obtained for permissions reasons.
PersistException - in the case of a database error.
GatewayException - in the case of an error with a remove server.
ServiceException - in the case of another error in the core service

requestCredential

DeliveryResult requestCredential(TDescriptor descriptor,
                                 java.lang.String locale,
                                 TCredentialRequestPurpose purpose,
                                 TCredentialRequestDestination destination,
                                 TCredentialRequestDeliveryType deliveryType,
                                 TCredentialRequestType type)
                                 throws AuthenticationException.NoSuchAccount,
                                        AuthenticationException.PasswordExpired,
                                        AuthorizationException.AccountSuspended,
                                        AuthorizationException.NotPermitted,
                                        AuthorizationException.UnprovisionedAccount,
                                        GatewayException,
                                        PersistException,
                                        ServiceException,
                                        OperationException.NotFound,
                                        OperationException.DuplicateAccount
Method to allow a user to request a credential for some usage of Finder. The method does not return the credential itself, but will undertake a Finder specified action that will result in some a credential being delivered to a user. It returns a DeliveryResult that indicates what Finder did to satisfy the request, or it throws an error.

Parameters:
descriptor - - Identifying information provided by the user requesting a credential
locale - - The locale the user expects any notifications to be presented in.
purpose - - The purpose for the credential request.
destination - - The eventual destination at which the credential will be used. e.g. WEB, WAP.
deliveryType - - The method of delivery to be used, e.g. EMAIL, SMS.
type - - The type of credential requested, e.g. PASSWORD, TOKEN.
Returns:
An object representing the action undertaken including such favorites as EMAIL_SENT and SMS_SENT.
Throws:
AuthenticationException.NoSuchAccount - if the user made a request that requires creating an authOwner, but the user doesn't have a carrier account
AuthorizationException.AccountSuspended - if the user made a request that requires an active authOwner, but their authOwner is suspended.
AuthorizationException.NotPermitted - if the user is no permitted to make the credential request they just made.
AuthorizationException.UnprovisionedAccount - if the credential request requires an admin, but the admin is unprovisioned.
OperationException.NotFound - if the request requires an existing authOwner, but none exists.
OperationException.DuplicateAccount - if the request requires creating a new authOwner, but one already exists.
GatewayException - if we have trouble communicating with a remote server.
PersistException - if we have trouble with a database.
ServiceException - if we have trouble with a core service.
PasswordExpired
AuthenticationException.PasswordExpired
